Where explanation or discussion is required, support your answers with relevant information and/or specific examples.Pesticides have been utilized for many years to increase food production and control pest populations. Pesticide use can be both beneficial and harmful to humans and other organisms.(a) Pesticide use has advantages, disadvantages, and unintended consequences on human health. Describe one benefit to human health that can result from the use of pesticides.
(b) Identify one way chemical pesticides can enter the human body.

Cotton farmers in the southern United States used a chemical pesticide to control an insect cotton-crop pest over a <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-year period. To study the effectiveness of the pesticide as an insect pest-control strategy, traps were placed in treated cotton fields and the number of pests captured were compared to application rates for the pesticide. The results of the study are shown in the table below. Year Grams of Pesticide Applied per Hectare Number of Crop Insect Pests Captured 1960 <math alttext="0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="700" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>700</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 1975 <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 1980 <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 1985 <math alttext="500" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 1990 <math alttext="550" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>550</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="14" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>14</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 1995 <math alttext="600" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>600</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="83" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>83</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 2000 <math alttext="700" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>700</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="150" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>150</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 2005 <math alttext="800" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>800</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="405" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>405</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 2010 <math alttext="900" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>900</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="727" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>727</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 2015 <math alttext="1,000" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></math> <math alttext="1,100" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mtext>,</mtext><mn>100</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> (c) Use the data in the table to answer the following questions. (i) Identify the year when the pesticide was most effective at reducing the size of the pest population.
(ii) Describe the change in the number of crop insect pests in the cotton fields over time.

(iii) Explain how the change in the cotton-crop pesticide effectiveness between the initial application in 1975 and the latest application in 2015 illustrates genetic resistance in pests, based on the data in the table.
(d) Describe TWO effects of pesticide use, other than death, on nontarget wildlife.

(e) There are many problems associated with the repeated application of chemical pesticides to reduce pest populations.(i) Crop rotation is often used to reduce pesticide use. Describe the process of crop rotation.
(ii) Propose one reasonable method, other than crop rotation, of reducing the use of pesticides in agricultural practices while still maintaining a high crop yield.
(iii) Justify how the method proposed in (e)(ii) would provide a benefit to humans.
